channel.title: BBC News - Wales

item.title: Covid: Travellers from Wales can soon use private PCR tests
item.description: There was criticism people in Wales had to pay for NHS tests while those in England could "shop around".

item.title: Inquest delays: Three-year wait for answers over death of girl, 4
item.description: Skyla Whiting died with sepsis days after becoming unwell with an upset tummy in May 2018.

item.title: TUC: Jobs at risk if UK fails to hit carbon emissions target
item.description: Trade bodies and unions say the UK is slipping behind other nations on green investment.

item.title: YesCymru: Welsh independence group must act, a founder says
item.description: Scotland's push for an independence referendum means Wales must be ready too, says Siôn Jobbins.

item.title: Finsbury Park mosque attacker fears eye loss after prison stabbing
item.description: The Finsbury Park mosque attacker was stabbed by an inmate while serving a life sentence for murder.

item.title: Covid third wave 'perfect storm' for care in Hywel Dda
item.description: It comes as some Welsh boards postpone routine surgery and halt some visits as Covid cases rise.

item.title: Boundaries review on MPs leaves five battles looming
item.description: Some of the big implications from plans to redraw Westminster's political map in Wales.

item.title: Runner airlifted to hospital after Anglesey cliff fall
item.description: A major search and rescue operation was launched to rescue the woman after her fall.

item.title: Rare wild flowers growing in Ruthin meadows, council says
item.description: One local said a mouse had gnawed its way into her bedroom because they are too close to homes.

item.title: Universal Credit: Families must choose food or fuel in benefits cut
item.description: Mothers on strict budgets and a poverty charity call for the universal credit boost to remain.

item.title: Covid: Wales vaccine passport decision due next week
item.description: It comes as Wales' first minister warns daily Covid hospital admissions could more than double.

item.title: Motorcyclist dies following crash with car on A493
item.description: A male motorcyclist in his 70s died at the scene of the crash in Gwynedd, police say.

item.title: Afghan refugees 'leave everything behind and have nothing'
item.description: Wales' Afghan community have been collecting clothes, shoes, toys and nappies for children.

item.title: Covid in Wales: No vaccine passports needed for public services
item.description: The Welsh government is considering whether vaccine passports should be introduced in some settings.

item.title: Endometriosis: 'I thought I would die from period blood loss'
item.description: Anna Cooper was told was nothing wrong but has now had 13 surgeries due to endometriosis.

item.title: Climbing: All-women Pinnacle Club celebrates its centenary
item.description: An all-women club for climbers marks its centenary where it began - in Snowdonia.

item.title: Lynette White murder: Man falsely accused relives 'nightmare'
item.description: Five men spent time in prison after being wrongly accused of killing Lynette White in 1988.

item.title: Pontypridd market street food Michelin-star chefs for food gong
item.description: Janet Wei beat some chefs who worked in Michelin-star restaurants to claim the title.

item.title: Swansea City summer transfers 'positive' - chief executive Julian Winter
item.description: Chief executive Julian Winter defends Swansea City's transfer dealings, saying the summer window was "positive" for the Championship club.

item.title: Dragons consider fresh name change - chairman Buttress
item.description: Dragons chairman David Buttress says they are considering a name change in the wake of Cardiff Blues becoming Cardiff Rugby.

item.title: World Cup of Darts: Wales' Gerwyn Price and Jonny Clayton advance to last eight
item.description: Defending champions Gerwyn Price and Jonny Clayton secure their place in the World Cup of Darts quarter finals with victory over Lithuania in Jena, Germany.

item.title: Swansea City 0-0 Hull City: Tigers dig in to leave Swans frustrated
item.description: Swansea City are held to a goalless draw by Hull City, leaving Russell Martin still waiting for a first home league win at his new club.

item.title: Wrexham 1-0 Woking: Jordan Davies goal earns first home win
item.description: Jordan Davies' first half header earns 10-man Wrexham their first home win of the season with victory over Woking.

item.title: Teithwyr o Gymru i gael defnyddio profion PCR preifat yn fuan
item.description: Gall teithwyr tramor o Gymru ddefnyddio dewis ehangach o gwmnïau profi Covid o 21 Medi.

item.title: Rhedwr wedi disgyn 60 troedfedd oddi ar glogwyn ym Môn
item.description: Cafodd y ddynes ei chludo i'r ysbyty ar ôl cwympo 60 troedfedd oddi ar glogwyn mewn ras ym Môn.

item.title: YesCymru: 'Rhaid rhoi egos i'r naill ochr a gweithredu'
item.description: Dywed cyn-gadeirydd YesCymru bod rhaid i'r mudiad weithredu ar frys yn sgil cyhoeddiad Yr Alban.

item.title: Oriel: Ras fynydd 'anoddaf yn y byd'
item.description: Dim ond chwarter o gystadleuwyr Ras Cefn y Ddraig orffennodd y ras - a does ryfedd o weld y lluniau yma!

item.title: Cymro yn ennill Ras Cefn y Ddraig am y tro cyntaf
item.description: Rhedwr o Bontypridd yn ennill y ras 380km o hyd, sy'n esgyn bron ddwywaith uchder Everest.
